title: Congressman Olver Denounces "Foolhardy" Surface Transportation Proposal

outline.text: Congressman Olver Denounces "Foolhardy" Surface Transportation Proposal
Washington, DC—Yesterday, Republicans on the House Transportation and Infrastructure
Committee unveiled the framework for a controversial multi-year surface transportation proposal
to reauthorize the Nation’s highway, highway safety, transit, and rail programs.  Breaking with
Committee precedent and tradition, the current proposal was drafted by the Republican Majority
with no consultation or input from the Democratic Minority.
“Although many details of this proposal remain in the dark, based on the funding levels alone, it
appears that this bill can best be called the ‘Republican Road to Ruin’ because it would
undermine our nation’s fragile economic recovery,” said Congressman Olver.  “The foolhardy
cuts proposed to highway, highway safety and rail programs will destroy nearly 500,000
American jobs next year alone, as well as jeopardize the nation’s long-term economic
The proposed legislation would cut $109 billion in surface transportation investments.
Construction unemployment in the United States continues to hover around 16%.
